alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains; Curry County; De Baca County; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 7:10PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORM OUTFLOW WINDS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL ROOSEVELT, SOUTHEASTERN DE BACA, NORTH CENTRAL CHAVES AND CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM MDT... At 709 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorm outflow winds along a line extending from near Broadview to near Ranchvale to 7 miles southwest of Melrose to 9 miles south of Tolar to near Fort Sumner. Movement of the boundary was southeast to south at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clovis, Portales, Texico, Melrose, Saint Vrain, Ranchvale, Oasis State Park, Cannon Air Force Base, Broadview and Bellview. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 360 and 397. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.

area.areaDesc: Chaves County Plains; Curry County; De Baca County; Roosevelt County
